text.#text:
The relationship
			 between the United States and the Socialist Republic of Vietnam has grown
			 substantially since the end of the trade embargo in 1994, with annual trade
			 between the countries reaching more than $24,800,000,000 in 2012.

However, the
			 transition by the Government of Vietnam toward greater economic activity and
			 trade, which has led to increased bilateral engagement between the United
			 States and Vietnam, has not been matched by greater political freedom or
			 substantial improvements in basic human rights for the people of
			 Vietnam.

Vietnam remains
			 an authoritarian state ruled by the Communist Party of Vietnam, which continues
			 to deny the right of the people of Vietnam to participate in free and fair
			 elections.
